perturbation.original_text: 5.5. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York. The parties unconditionally and irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of New York and waive any objection with respect thereto, for the purpose of any action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, unless both parties agree to resolve it out of court by the state where the Licensee resides. The parties unconditionally and irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of New York and waive any objection with respect thereto, for the purpose of any action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless both parties agree to resolve it out of court by the state where the Licensee resides' contradicts the original clause that specifies New York law and jurisdiction. This introduces uncertainty and could lead to disputes over which jurisdiction applies, weakening the enforceability of the original clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law and Jurisdiction clauses require clarity and certainty.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve as investment adviser to the Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days' written notice to the other party; or by Licensee at any time in the event Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee's rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve as investment adviser to the Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days' written notice to the other party; or by Licensee at any time in the event Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee's rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor, unless the parties find it mutually beneficial to continue it.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless the parties find it mutually beneficial to continue it' adds a contingency that contradicts the clearly stated termination conditions. This vague condition undermines the defined termination rights and introduces ambiguity as to when the agreement actually terminates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Termination clauses must be clear and unambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: 2.3. Notification of Infringement. Each party shall immediately notify the other party and provide to the other party all relevant background facts upon becoming aware of (a) any registrations of, or applications for registration of, marks in the Territory that do or may conflict with the Licensor's rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any infringements or misuse of the Licensed Mark in the Territory by any third party ("Third Party Infringement"), or (c) any claim that Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark infringes the intellectual property rights of any third party in the Territory ("Third Party Claim"). Licensor shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim, and to take any other action that it deems necessary or proper for the protection and preservation of its rights in the Licensed Mark. Licensee shall cooperate with Licensor in the prosecution, defense or settlement of such actions, proceedings or claims.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.3. Notification of Infringement. Each party shall immediately notify the other party and provide to the other party all relevant background facts upon becoming aware of (a) any registrations of, or applications for registration of, marks in the Territory that do or may conflict with the Licensor's rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any infringements or misuse of the Licensed Mark in the Territory by any third party ("Third Party Infringement"), or (c) any claim that Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark infringes the intellectual property rights of any third party in the Territory ("Third Party Claim"). Licensor shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim, unless the Licensee is able to resolve it themselves, and to take any other action that it deems necessary or proper for the protection and preservation of its rights in the Licensed Mark. Licensee shall cooperate with Licensor in the prosecution, defense or settlement of such actions, proceedings or claims.
perturbation.explanation: By inserting the phrase 'unless the Licensee is able to resolve it themselves', we create a contradiction. The original clause grants the Licensor 'exclusive right, but not the obligation' to handle infringements. However, the added clause implies that the Licensee can independently handle these issues, conflicting with the Licensor's designated right and creating ambiguity on who has the authority to act.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trademark Law - Control over trademark protection is typically held by the trademark owner (Licensor here), and unauthorized actions by the licensee can weaken the mark.
